note.p: Birth: Red Scar, near Preston, Lancashire, England (30 May 1823)
Death: Eccle Riggs, Broughton-in-Furness, Lancashire (08 January 1914)
Education: Rugby; Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1846). Lincoln's Inn (entered 1844). DCL (1877, Oxford), LLD (1878, Cambridge), LLD (1885, St Andrews)

Career: Called to the Bar, Inner Temple (1849); Bencher (1876); MP for Preston (1857-1862); MP for South West Lancashire (1868-1885); Privy Councillor (1874); Home Secretary (1874-1880 and 1885-1886); MP for the Newton Division (1885-1886); Secretary of State for India (1886-1892); Privy Seal (1895-1900)
